description:
Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (Google Ads, AdSense, Google Marketing Platform, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across Sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.

The YouTube Ads Marketing team enables marketers to connect with their audiences and tap into YouTube, in order to build their brands. As a Marketing Manager for Scaled Programs, you'll be responsible for cultivating brand affinity for YouTube among marketing decision-makers. You’ll oversee the global strategy to make content relatable through scaled and high-touch programs.

Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 4 years of relevant experience.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Expertise in developing customer insights, using in-depth market analysis to guide strategic approach, and building compelling, impactful programs.
  • Proven ability to deliver excellent and creative marketing achievements.
  • Growth mindset, with a desire to continually learn and grow as a marketer and leader. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and changing environment.
  • Demonstrated analytical skills, including proven ability to manage return on investment (both quantitative and qualitative) and measure success.
  • Organized and self-motivated, with excellent execution, proactive problem-solving skills, resourcefulness and attention to detail.
  • Understanding of YouTube's strategic and competitive position and of online video advertising. Excellent communication and writing skills.
responsibilities:
• Lead a user-first strategy to consolidate YouTube/Google’s B2B newsletters.
  • Lead strategy to enhance advertisers’ perception of YouTube’s content quality by making YouTube relatable through scaled and high-touch activations, including amplifying YouTube Originals and crossover celebrities, elevating YouTube content and research.
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with YouTube Ads Marketing, Sales, Consumer Marketing and Events Marketing teams to execute content quality plans.
  • Curate and develop editorial content that familiarizes marketers with YouTube to support consolidated newsletter.
title: Marketing Manager, Scaled Programs, YouTube Ads Marketing
